intro: Ceropegia gondwanensis, commonly known as the Gondwana milkweed, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its trailing stems and clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically white or pale green. The plant produces a milky sap, which is a common feature among species in the Asclepiadaceae family. It thrives in well-drained soils and requires bright, indirect light to flourish. Ceropegia gondwanensis is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and adaptability to various growing conditions.
